meanings.definition: Relating to the effects of weather on living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The biometeorological conditions were perfect for the plants to thrive.
meanings.sent2: Scientists conducted a biometeorological study to understand how weather affects animals.
meanings.sent3: The biometeorological forecast predicted a sunny day for the birds to enjoy.
meanings.sent4: The biometeorological impact of the storm on the trees was evident in the aftermath.
meanings.sent5: Children learned about biometeorological patterns in school to understand nature better.

meanings.definition: Study of the relationship between weather and living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The biometeorological revealed fascinating insights into how weather influences plants.
meanings.sent2: Researchers in biometeorological explore the effects of climate change on ecosystems.
meanings.sent3: During the biometeorological class, students learned about the connection between weather and animals.
meanings.sent4: The biometeorological of insects in different climates is a key focus of the study.
meanings.sent5: The textbook on biometeorological provided a comprehensive overview of the subject.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the impact of weather on human health.
meanings.sent1: The biometeorological conditions led to an increase in respiratory illnesses.
meanings.sent2: Doctors advised patients to be cautious during biometeorological changes.
meanings.sent3: Despite the biometeorological warnings, people still enjoyed outdoor activities.
meanings.sent4: The biometeorological effects of the heatwave were felt across the city.
meanings.sent5: Understanding biometeorological factors can help in preventing weather-related health issues.
